attributes.action: Have another vote on leaving the EU. Canada-style agreement or no deal?
attributes.background: If the Chequers agreement is rejected, I feel the people should have a vote on what happens next, which is why I feel we should get a vote on the UK and EU agreeing an EU/Canada-style comprehensive economic and trade agreement or no deal.

attributes.action: a maximum amount to be specified for school uniforms
attributes.background: School uniforms are now ridiculously expensive and even primarily schools are now setting excessive rules on school uniforms.  Parents are effectively paying hundreds of pounds in “fees” just to send a child to school.  Parents should not have pay for these excessive uniforms
attributes.additional_details: Schools should be ordered to set a maximum amount of £50 for the whole uniform and any costs in excess of this must be bourne by the school.  This would also prevent schools from selecting one supplier who can then dictate the price people pay.  As education is mandatory parents should not be forced into paying excessive amounts just to send a child to school

attributes.action: Amend Microchip Regulations to require chip alerts for stolen dogs when scanned
attributes.background:
There is no method to raise an alert (where the dog is stolen) when a dog is scanned by a vet or authorised person.
When the data operators records show the dog as stolen, an alert should be made to the individual operating the microchip scanner to alert them to such. Confiscation laws introduced.
attributes.additional_details:
When a dog is scanned (i.e. by a veterinary practice) the only information being provided through the scanner is the microchip number. If the information included alert data which was recorded by the data operator, provided by the true keeper, this could help with the recovery of stolen dogs.
Police / RSPCA officers etc should be given scanners to support this and enable them to scan when they identify potentially vulnerable dogs.

attributes.action: Prevent a single MP being able to stop a Private Member’s Bill
attributes.background: Change the arcane parliamentary procedure of one MP being able to shout “Object!” to block a potentially viable & widely supported Private Members Bill (like upskirting or FGM protection) and insert better protection mechanism e.g. forcing vote to stop Bill progress or set number objecting.

attributes.action: More funding for treatment of women's pelvic conditions to reduce waiting times
attributes.background: Women with female-specific pelvic problems such as fibroids, pelvic inflammation and endometriosis may be left in severe pain for months as there is not enough funding to get quick treatment. These conditions despite the awful symptoms, are not considered serious and are massively underfunded.
attributes.additional_details: While the symptoms are not life threatening they are certainly life altering. Just because the help we need as women is more invasive it does not mean we should just be left in pain. It must change. I have endometriosis and have been waiting over 18 weeks since my initial consultation for a laparoscopy. I've been in A&E 5 times whilst waiting for date because the pain is unbearable and no painkillers help. Women must be offered more support.

attributes.action: Ban Zero Hour Contracts for all 3rd Party Dock Workers and Stevedores.
attributes.background:
The National Dock Labour Board,
set up in 1947, registered all port
workers and guaranteed that dockers
had a basic minimum fallback wage,
whether there was work for them or
not.  In 1989 the Tory Goverment used legislation to remove these rights to fall back pay.
attributes.additional_details:
Ports continue to use 3rd Party Dock Workers through agencies who only provide zero hour contracts.  The ports side step any labour issues by claiming they do not employ these people the agencies do.
Zero hour contracts lead to unsafe practices as training and experience is often lost as these skills are replaced by the untrained and inexperienced staff.   People die in this industry because of this.

attributes.action: Make it a mandatory minimum age of 18 to join all social media platforms.
attributes.background:
Children under the age of 18 are exposed to adult content, videos of violence and sexual content on social media sites, some that have age requirements of 13 years to join.
This is damaging to society.
attributes.additional_details: Social media is being used as a tool to promote gang culture, knife crime and robbery and being openly available to view on apps like Snapchat, Facebook and Instagram. Young girls are exposed to sexual content and images that are digitally altered, which has a huge effect on mental health. 18 years old should be a minimum age to engage on these platforms.

attributes.action: All public institutions must use toiletries that contain no animal ingredients.
attributes.background:
Ethical veganism is not limited to what is eaten, but to everything that is used; it is about minimising harm in all aspects of our lives.
It is reasonable for all public institutions to be mandated to use toiletries that contain no animal ingredients and that are not tested on animals.
attributes.additional_details:
The right to practice your religion and belief is covered under article 9 of the European Convention of Human Rights and the UK's Equality Act.

Under this legislation, the right to hold and practice the view of ethical veganism is recognised. For example: those who are in hospital, school or prison, have the right to request vegan food options. The logic here is the same, we have the right to have vegans options for the washing of our hands.

attributes.action: Fine people for leaving a dog tied up and unattended
attributes.background: Please make it illegal and fine those who leave dogs tied up and unattended.
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs who are left outside, tied up, unattended are at risk.
They are more likely to get stolen which is traumatic for the owner and a waste of police resources when so easily avoided. Most of these dogs are not reunited with their families. This should be the responsibility of the owner. Many are not aware dog theft is on the rise in UK by 25% in the last few years.
Additionally the owner may not be aware they made need to clean up after their dog if they have not seen it fouling the pavement.
It can also create issues amongst passing dogs if pavements and paths are blocked by another dog that is restrained. As well as those who are fearful of dogs but have no option to approach if the path is blocked by a dog.

attributes.action: Legalise assisted dying for terminal illnesses.
attributes.background: It's wrong that doctors have to keep alive people who are in either serious physical or mental distress when they wish to end their own lives.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone should be able to do whatever they want with their own lives. We're all supposed to live in a country where we supposedly have pure freedom. People can't end their lives if their life is a horror every day.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for secondary schools to isolate pupils
attributes.background: Across England, many secondary schools isolate students for hours, days or weeks at a time, this is only detrimental to a students’ mental health but questionably against the human rights of pupils, this is not a punishment but a custodial sentence in some instances
attributes.additional_details: Schools should not be allowed to isolate pupils for more than one hour, the secondary school I attended (till August 2017) this year would isolate students for something as trivial as a short haircut. Isolation is infringing on the liberties of young people across the country and it should not be tolerated, the problem is more widespread than I thought as many schools across the UK use isolation to reprimand students. Segregation does not breed well rounded individuals.

attributes.action: Make businesses label the environmental footprint of their products
attributes.background: I believe that businesses should be made to include a carbon footprint/ environmental impact score on their products, in the same way as food products have the traffic light health labels.
attributes.additional_details:
For consumers it can be so hard to know how good or bad different products are for the environment, and what can seem like a positive change (e.g. reduced plastic) can sometimes actually be worse in terms of environmental impact (e.g. more water or energy to produce). 
 
Having this sort of labelling will provide that insight so purchases can be more informed. It will also encourage manufacturers to do more to improve their practices so their eco scores are better than their competitors.

attributes.action: Change the current process when bringing complaints to the IOPC
attributes.background: The IOPC (formerly the IPCC) is responsible for overseeing complaints made against police forces in England and Wales. However, the current procedure allows Chief Constables to circumnavigate the IOPC and investigate complaints themselves. We want this changed to make the IOPC truly independent.
attributes.additional_details: When a complaint is made to the IOPC the current procedure is that it is sent to the Chief Constable of the force being complained about. It is then the decision of that Chief Constable whether he/she will investigate or hand it back to the IOPC. This current system is not independent or fair and means that in many cases the complainant is prevented by the police from being heard by anyone impartial unless they apply for a Judicial Review afterwards, which is beyond the financial means of most.

attributes.action: Review the unfair school fine system where 2 parent families pay twice
attributes.background: The penalty for taking a child out of school is on a per person, per child basis. This means two parent families have to pay the fine twice. This is unfair and should be reviewed.

attributes.action: Request for help and assist for serious flood situation Kerala, India,
attributes.background: This petition on behalf of Malayalies in UK and their families and friends in Kerala included among the 35 Million, the southern state of India. Death toll is rising every hour, every minute. More than 250,000 people have fled their homes.The aged, young, ill and pregnant are stranded.
attributes.additional_details:
All the shutters of 36 of the 39 reservoirs have been open and it was continuously and heavily raining for the past one week.

We beg for mercy in front of the whole world, we need help

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-india-45216671

https://www.facebook.com/johnygeorge.kalathiparambil/videos/1830622453700580/UzpfSTEwMDAwNTE3MDcxNDIwNDoxMDY3Nzk3ODk2NzM1ODkx/
https://news.sky.com/world
https://edition.cnn.com/2018/08/17/asia/kerala-flood-death-rise-intl/index.html

attributes.action: Scrap the age pay gap. Living costs don't differ depending on age.
attributes.background: No matter your age, the price of milk costs the same. The difference in hourly wage between those aged under 18 and those aged 25 and over is £3.86. Which, coincidentally, is actually more than the minimum wage for apprenticeships.
attributes.additional_details: There are hundreds of thousands of people in the UK under 25 years old, who live with dependents. People who care for their children, younger siblings, disabled relatives etc. Their age should not impede their renumeration for the same level of work as someone that is simply older than them. Everyone pays the same for petrol, pays the same level of tax, and buys the same food. Let's stop this segregated, illogical pay gap and give people the pay they deserve. The National Living Wage.

attributes.action: Make Albanian a GCSE or A Level
attributes.background: There are thousands and thousands of young Albanians and Kosovans across our country, and we have to value this, make 'Shqip' a language you can pick for your GCSE's. England is supposed to be a very multicultural country and we have to value it.

attributes.action: Make light reflectors mandatory for childrens prams & strollers
attributes.background: The law regarding light reflectors on prams/strollers in the U.K needs to change. Prams/strollers are currently not required by law to have any reflector of any kind, with priority given to style & the safely of the actual pram.
attributes.additional_details:
The pram will always be in front of the adult when being pushed. Crossing the road can be a hazard that cars may not see - with special consideration to darker prams, when a crossing is not available & along country roads.
 
Having reflectors will enable vehicle drivers to see the hazard a few crucial seconds before they would have without the reflectors.

attributes.action: Appoint a Minister for Men and Equalities to address issues facing men and boys.
attributes.background:
Over the last couple of years there has been a lot of focus on issues affecting women and girls. This is good because when issues are openly discussed attitudes can be changed and solutions found.
There are also many issues facing men and boys which do not often receive the attention they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Compared to women, men are:

Over three times more likely to take their own lives
Over six times more likely to be sleeping rough
Three times more likely to be homeless

Too many young men and boys are losing their lives to knife crime.

There is a lack of male primary school teachers to act as positive role models for boys - one in four primaries has not a single male teacher. 

A screening programme for prostate cancer is long overdue.

The government’s current approach to all this is failing.

attributes.action: Make new car led lights less bright
attributes.background: Old style lights on cars worked fine. Now driving at night had become quite dangerous for other road users especially  motorcyclists. Many occasions I’ve had to come to a near stop until the other car has passed. Something needs to be done.
attributes.additional_details: Two thirds of Britain’s drivers complain they are regularly dazzled by the headlights of modern vehicles, according to a new report today. Some 65 per cent of more than 2,000 motorists surveyed say they regularly get dazzled by oncoming headlights even though they are dipped.And fifteen per cent of motorists surveyed by the RAC claim they have suffered a near-miss as a result of being dazzled by modern headlights that they believe are too bright.

attributes.action: Increase funding for GICS and Transgender availability for hormones and surgery
attributes.background: Currently, GICS have over a year average waiting time for NHS funded hormones, thousands every year applying for hormone and surgery access. Many Transgender people every year die due to prejudice. With increasing funding for NHS GICs, transgender people will be able to get help much more quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Transgender people are waiting up to two and a half years for initial consultations at NHS gender identity clinics. This is despite an NHS England pledge in 2016 to bring waiting times to below 18 weeks by 2018. The average wait from receiving a GP referral to getting a first appointment is 18 months. [Source: BBC]

8/10 trans young people have self-harmed and almost half have attempted to kill themselves, according to new study looking at the experiences of LGBT pupils in schools across the UK.

attributes.action: The government need to put more money into road signs and cameras
attributes.background: I would like more things put in place to protect people not just on the moterways but on our streets and roads where we live. More money should be put into advanced technology for catching people speeding, like cameras on our roads, because they cost a lot it's very hard to get one on our streets.

attributes.action: Yemen: Call for ceasefire and support 6-point pledge to end conflict and famine
attributes.background:
With 85k children perished so far and 8m people on verge of starvation, the UK must act to protect the people of Yemen.
The government must call for a ceasefire, the adoption of a new UN Security Council resolution, proper funding of humanitarian relief, and investigation of alleged war crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
The six point pledge was drawn up by NGOs, politicians and members of the UN.

http://blog.handicap-international.org/influenceandethics/2018/11/12/alert-35-organizations-call-for-immediate-cessation-of-hostilities-in-yemen/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/nov/22/famine-yemen-war-crime-civilians-saudi-coalition

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/yemen-war-latest-news-starving-save-the-children-yemeni-famine-a8643906.html

attributes.action: Parliament Must reject the EU withdrawal agreement that is on the table.
attributes.background: This agreement is not fit for purpose it gives the EU everything they want but the UK must wait to see what it gets, and there is no way out.

attributes.action: Remove bylaw that means boat owners get prosecuted and fined as well as skippers
attributes.background: The IFCA’s that patrol and enforce out  to 6 mile waters have introduced a new bylaw that means if a skipper is prosecuted for an offence that the owners of the boat automatically get convicted and fined if the skipper is found guilty. This is an injustice to the boat owners.
attributes.additional_details: This is just a money making exercise for them and not in the best interest of the fishing industry. We need to stop this now

attributes.action: Publicly reject Action on Sugar's call for a "milkshake ban"
attributes.background:
Action on Sugar, a British pressure group, has called for all milkshakes with more than 300 calories to be banned for health reasons. 

This is absurd, and would be a huge government overreach. Large, thick milkshakes are a tasty occasional treat, and virtually everyone treats them as such.
attributes.additional_details:
Action on Sugar is basing their wild demand for a ban based on the ridiculous assumption that these kinds of milkshakes would be "consumed on a daily basis", to quote their own chairman Graham McGregor.

The government should publicly state that they are not seriously considering this proposal. The obesity crisis is serious, but this is not the solution.

BBC report: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-46179175?SThisFB&fbclid=IwAR2_MwWYdlQU4p8SeoADkSdm40-8ajWkqgkqdzXQTKH0iXH0tz0U2qpM3a0

attributes.action: Make this country a true democracy.
attributes.background:
Voting for an MP or a political party involves compromise since it is unlikely that either will precisely represent an individual's views on a range of issues.
The technology now exists for people to vote easily on any popular issue but the government is currently able to ignore those wishes.
attributes.additional_details:
1)	Make the government e-petitions website more widely publicised on a regular basis, on TV for instance 
2)	Make it mandatory for the government to hold a referendum where any petition requesting a referendum exceeds 100,000 signatures
3)	Make all referendums available online
4)	Make the results of the referendums mandatory. The government MUST act on them.

attributes.action: Ban Saturday school in all private schools to make the systems fair
attributes.background: Many private schools have Saturday school and many others don’t. Saturday school is a huge effort and much more money for parents to spend on their education. As a student you need rest and Saturday school does not allow this.

attributes.action: Change the UK voting system to a legal requirement to increase voting turnout
attributes.background: Making voting a legal requirement will increase the turnout, making more uk citizens happier with the results. Currently, only 60% of the registered voters take part, which leaves 40% unhappy with the turnout as that have not cast a vote. We would like to change this and make voting compulsory.

attributes.action: Fund a national day and memorial to the sacrifices of LGBT+ campaigners
attributes.background: Fund an annual national day and a physical memorial in London to commemorate the sacrifices of LGBT+ campaigners. We are a divided people so to have this one national day will remind us of the rights we have fought for so the young and old can come together to give hope to future generations.

attributes.action: All U.K nightclub doorways to have knife and gun detection arches by law.
attributes.background: We have a major Knife crime problem in our UK cities right now. We want to make knife and gun detection arches compulsory by law at all night clubs controlled by security Industry Authority door supervisors, with stop and search rights on all that enter private and public drinking venues.
attributes.additional_details: Many knife incidents occur in nightclubs, we as members of the public need more protection. The government along with the security Industry Authority (SIA) must apply a new law with the license holders of all night clubs in the UK that will see knife and gun detection arches become compulsory.

attributes.action: Change the law so the driver not the owner is responsible for a PCN
attributes.background:
My local council wrongly ticketed my company vehicle 
My company paid this fine and because the fine was paid the council closed the matter making impossible to appeal the ticket 
But my company then took this money from my wages leaving me out of pocket
attributes.additional_details:
On a non endorseable ticket it’s the owner not the driver that is liable 
However if you drive a company car your employer will more than likely pay the fine as ultimately they Will just deduct the money from this from your wages

attributes.action: Provide more direct investment in nuclear new build projects in the U.K.
attributes.background:
In the last few months, two major developers have pulled out of plans to develop large scale new nuclear in the UK. 

In order to meet future electricity demand and reach climate change targets, no other low carbon technologies are available to replace reliable baseload electricity supply.
attributes.additional_details:
The two suspended projects would have produced 9.2GW of low carbon electricity to the national grid, avoiding millions of tonnes of CO2 emissions each year. At their peaks these projects would have also provided tens of thousands of jobs, a huge boost to the local economy. 

This World Nuclear Association presents the main benefits of nuclear power: http://www.world-nuclear.org/information-library/current-and-future-generation/world-energy-needs-and-nuclear-power.aspx

attributes.action: End Austerity and increase funding to NHS, Schools & Housing Authority
attributes.background: NHS workers have been overworked. They are tired, depressed, and most of all exhausted. NHS funding, quite simply, is totally inadequate. The same can be said about our Schools. Homelessness is the highest it has ever been.

attributes.action: Discuss how supported employment can be made mandatory to include the disabled.
attributes.background:
Looking at figures of the employment sector it is noted that 80% of people without any health barrier are employed compared to people who have health barriers at shocking low of 43.6%.

Figures like these are shocking and need to be addressed such as employers attiude towards disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Below is a link of how supported employment can change and help a person with barriers make the economy and society whole.

This petition is the beginning of inclusion and wider understanding of disability towards recruitment processes within the private, public and self employed organisations.

https://www.mylondon.news/news/south-london-news/unsung-hero-who-helps-disabled-15510468

attributes.action: Pass a new law on access to evidence so the wrongly convicted can get justice
attributes.background: Too often, police and prosecutors are failing to disclose crucial evidence, which means that innocent people end up in prison while the guilty walk free.
attributes.additional_details:
Yet under the current law, it is almost impossible for innocent prisoners to win back their freedom by accessing evidence wrongly withheld from them.
 
Disclosure failings are the biggest cause of miscarriages of justice. A former CPS head said potentially thousands of innocent people are languishing in our prisons due to failures to hand over evidence to the defence.
 
To ensure justice for wrongly convicted victims of disclosure failings, Parliament should pass a new law giving convicted defendants the right to access all non-sensitive material held by the police and CPS on their case and to instruct special counsel to inspect sensitive files.

attributes.action: The government should grant £61,000,000 to children’s charities.
attributes.background: Children in Need do fantastic work across the UK. The Government should match the funding made by public donation to double the money available to children’s charities.
attributes.additional_details: £61,000,000 is available this year and, additionally, further funds can be allocated via Gift Aid.

attributes.action: Name one of Her Majesties warships HMS Walker
attributes.background: Captain Walker was a superb Captain in WW2 in anti submarine warfare and died aged 48 in 1944. He was a highly decorated officer who died from exhaustion and overwork in 1944, his son was killed onboard HMSubmarine Parthian in 1943.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederic_John_Walker

Walker sank more U-boats during the Battle of the Atlantic than any other British or Allied commander, and he was instrumental in the Allied victory of the Battle of the Atlantic.

attributes.action: Ban Fireworks that are toxic to both the environment and humans!
attributes.background: To produce the oxygen needed for fireworks, many fireworks contain oxidisers known as perchlorates. These can dissolve in water, contaminating rivers, lakes and drinking water.
attributes.additional_details: "Fireworks get their flamboyance from a variety of chemicals, many of which are toxic to humans. From the gunpowder that fuels their flight to the metallic compounds that colour their explosions, fireworks often contain carcinogenic or hormone-disrupting substances that can seep into soil and water, not to mention the lung-clogging smoke they release and plastic debris they scatter."

attributes.action: Abolish faith schools
attributes.background: Children under no circumstance should be submitted to education in religious schools. We should encourage future generations to have an academic mindset free from religious belief.
attributes.additional_details: Religion is a choice that should be made in adulthood and not influenced and preached onto young growing minds.

attributes.action: Change the law regarding organ donation so no consent required from next of kin
attributes.background: Last year my husband died. He was on the organ donor list yet they still required my consent as his next of kin to allow the donation procedure to be done. If i had declined consent they wouldn't be allowed to take his organs even though he himself had consented whilst alive. I find this very wrong
attributes.additional_details: The law currently requires that all  people on the organ donor register must have the permission of the next of kin after their death before the procedure can take place.I find this ridiculous. If you have made a choice whilst you are alive to donate your organs in the event of your death then how can it be that someone else, namely your next of kin,  can go against your wishes after your death.  This makes your choices whilst alive pretty pointless and meaningless and takes away your last wish

attributes.action: Hold a country wide referendum on whether we should bring back the death penalty
attributes.background: Our prisons are overcrowded and under funded bringing back the death penalty for crimes such as murder,terrorism,rape and peodphillia will reduce our prison population and will also save the tax payer millions if not billions a year.

attributes.action: Give UK armed forces recognition of their service during the cold war
attributes.background: Give UK armed forces personnel the same recognition as the rest of the world has done for their service during the cold war by allowing a medal too be issued.
attributes.additional_details: For all personnel who served past and present.

attributes.action: Ensure all schools offer reception children a full time education from September
attributes.background: Every September many schools accept reception children for only part of a day for up to 6 weeks, causing enormous difficulties for many parents. Working parents have to take leave, unpaid leave in the case of self-employed parents, or pay huge childcare costs while the phased start is in place
attributes.additional_details:
There is little awareness of a ruling by the Schools Adjudicator in 2013 who said, in reference to phased starts, “It is not permissible in my view for a school to deny a child a term of full-time education. The school has a duty to provide a full-time place from September and cannot refuse to do so.”

The latest school admissions code supports this, stating that a local authority must make clear that children are entitled to a full-time place in the Sept following their fourth birthday.

attributes.action: Replace the compulsory GCSE English Literature subject with Computer Science.
attributes.background: An increasing number of jobs require IT and far more than English Literature.

attributes.action: Give students free dental care and prescriptions on the NHS
attributes.background: Most students do not have any income, or if they do it is very minimal. Most students cannot afford dental treatment or prescriptions and avoid going to the doctors or dentist. This can mean that medical problems can go untreated and thus cost the NHS more in the long term.

attributes.action: Make nutrition a mandatory subject for children to learn in schools.
attributes.background: Making nutrition a mandatory subject in schools will help in the growing obesity rates in children and adults, this will lead to less of a strain on the NHS in the future.

attributes.action: Ban plastic bags
attributes.background:
The solution:
A law was introduced in October 2015 to have a 5p charge on plastic bags and are now planning to raise the charge to 10p in January 2020. This law has failed to significantly reduce waste. So what is the simple solution to all of this? Ban plastic bags all together by January 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
The issue:
Once we are finished with our plastic bags, we throw them in the bin ready for them to be taken to landfill. When they reach landfill, birds often mistake shredded plastic bags for food filling their stomachs with toxic debris. When a plastic bag reaches the ocean turtles cannot tell the difference between a jellyfish or a plastic bag. 91% of plastic waste isn’t recycled, meaning that the majority Virtually every piece of plastic that was ever made still exists in some shape or form.

attributes.action: Return old armed forces/emergency services pensions for those who signed for it.
attributes.background: All armed forces and emergency services personnel had their pensions reduced in 2015. I joined the armed forces and have lost many family while away thinking I knew what I’d get on retirement. The goal posts have been changed, I feel those sacrifices have been in vain. Re-instate original pensions.

attributes.action: Ban the import and sale of badger hair in the UK.
attributes.background: Badger hair is often used in Britain because of certain water-retaining properties it has; however, the evidence is that animals suffer, at best, appalling living conditions, and at worst, terrible abuse and neglect, in order to produce this hair.
attributes.additional_details: Badger farms, predominantly in Asia, have been filmed keeping badgers in horrific conditions in order to produce hair for items like shaving brushes and paint brushes. When other options, like horse-hair, and artificial hair, is freely available, there is no reason to support this cruel industry in any way whatsoever, and the UK should take a lead in banning the use of this commodity.
